turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Eddie, you still got it.  Hey, tomorrow maybe I'll go down to probate court and see who's sniffin' around Acme's estate?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, do that.  I'm gonna go rattle Maroon's cage.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: What was <u>that</u>?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: <u>That</u> was the rabbit's wife.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: The rabbit's wife?  Wanna tell me what she was doin' with her arms around you?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Probably lookin' for a good place to stick a knife.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I just stopped by to tell you that I checked out the Acme probate.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Maroon, right?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Nope.  It's that Cloverleaf outfit again.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What the hell would they want with a gag factory?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Got me.  But unless the will shows up by Friday midnight, it's theirs.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What's that comin' from the bar?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Sounds like singin'.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Oh, no...

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I was hopin' you'd be there.  Maroon's called here about four times.  He says he's gotta talk to you tonight.  He says he can help you.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I'll bet.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Are you gonna call him, Eddie?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What've I got to lose?  You okay, Dolores?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Yeah... they closed me down for a coupla weeks.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: That'll work out just fine.  When this thing is over, I'll take you to Catalina.  How does that sound?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Familiar.  Be careful, Eddie.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: He's not my client.  I was workin' for R.K. Maroon.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Yes, we talked to Mr. Maroon.  He told us the rabbit became quite agitated when you showed him the pictures, and said nothing would stand in the way of him getting his wife back.  Is that true?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Hey, pal, do I look like a stenographer?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Men?  They look more like weasles to me.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Yes, I find that weasles have a special gift for the work.  The rabbit didn't contact you by any chance, did he?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Why would he contact me?  I just took some lousy pictures.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: So you wouldn't have any idea where he might be?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Have you tried Walla Walla?  Kokomo's very nice this time of year.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Being caught breaking and entering is not very good advertising for a detective.  What were you looking for, Mr. Valiant?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Ask her...

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Marvin Acme had no will.  I should know, the probate is in my court.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: He had a will, all right.  She took it off Acme the night she and R.K. Maroon knocked him off.  Then she set up her loving husband to take the fall.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: They must've taken it off me.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: They?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: The other people who were in here lookin' for the will.  I woulda caught 'em if Cheetah here hadn't interrupted me.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Take it easy, Bongo.  We'll handle Mr. Valiant our own way... downtown.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Downtown?  Fine.  Get a hold of Santino, I'd be more than glad to talk to him.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Oh, not <u>that</u> downtown.  <u>Toon</u>town.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You're not takin' me to downtown <u>Toon</u>town?

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Indeed we are.  We'll continue the interrogation there.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I ain't tellin' you nothin'!  Get me Santino.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: You're a very stubborn man, Mr. Valiant.  Very pig-headed.  Boys, show Mr. Valiant how we handle pig-headed men at the Toontown station...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I don't think it's gonna matter. Sorry, pal, I tried.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Yes, and for that you're charged with aiding and abetting.  But we'll let Santino handle that.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Well, why not?  I'm feeling magnanimous tonight.  The successful conclusion of this case draws the curtain on my career as a jurist. I'm retiring to take a new role in the private sector.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah?  Well, don't expect the Toons to give you a gold watch.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: These roads can be very treacherous at night, especially in a maniacal Toon vehicle.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: The pot's callin' the kettle maniacal.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: I've had enough of your insolence!  Put him in my car.  I think they'll enjoy attending our ribbon cutting at the Acme factory.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: No matter.  I don't expect the will to show up in the next fifteen minutes.  By then Cloverleaf will own Toontown quite legally.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: So you're Cloverleaf?

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: No one person is Cloverleaf.  We're a vast company with diverse interests... gasoline, tires, automobiles.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Come on, Doom.  What would a company like that want with Toontown?

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: It wasn't Toontown they wanted.  It was my idea of how to put the land to better use.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Don't you think anyone's gonna notice that Toontown's gone?

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: They won't care.  Who's going to miss some ridiculous talking mice when they can have the future?

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Right here where we're standing, will be the cornerstone of my idea... the cloverleaf -- an elegant cement structure that intertwines freeways.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What the hell's a freeway?

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: A freeway, Mr. Valiant, is eight lanes of asphalt running uninterrupted from L.A. to Pasadena.  Pasadena to Hollywood.  Hollywood to Santa Monica. Someday everyone will be in cars driving happily, non-stop from one end of the L.A. Basin to another.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: That's what this is all about?  Tell me, who's gonna use your lousy freeway? We got the Red Cars, the best public transportation in the country.

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Not for long.  We're retiring the Red Cars.  People will drive, Mr. Valiant, because they'll have to.  And when they drive, they'll have to buy our cars, our tires, our gasoline.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Holy shit, he's a Toon!

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: Surprised?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Not really.  Only a Toon could think of something as goofy as that freeway idea.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You?

turns.speaker: DOOM
turns.text: That's right, me.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Here's one for the books... a Toon wearin' human clothes.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Earl... it's me, Valiant.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Eddie?  Jesus, what happened?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Toon cops worked me over.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Boy, I'll say.  They gave you a real Toon-a-Roo.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What am I, Earl?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're a pig... a happy-go-lucky pig.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Does it hurt?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Not much.  It's hard to talk.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Uh, Eddie, do me a favor.  Could you sit in the back so you won't cause as much of a commotion.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Last week some heavy breather wanted one of my nylons as a souvenir.  Maybe that's what he was after?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Look, doll, if I wanted underwear, I woulda broken into Frederick's of Hollywood.  I was lookin' for Marvin Acme's will.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Hello, Mr. Valiant.  I rang the doorbell, but I guess you couldn't hear it.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: That's because I don't have a doorbell.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Oh... well, I... I just had to see you.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Okay, you've seen me.  Now give me a towel.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Come on, lady, haven't you ever seen a mole before?

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Toons aren't given imperfections.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: No?  I guess we're not counting lying, stealing and murder.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: You've got the wrong idea about me. I'a a pawn in this just like poor Roger.  Can you help me find him?  I'll pay you anything.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, I'll bet you would.  You gotta have the rabbit to make the scam work.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: No, no, no... I love my husband.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Oh, sure.  I can just feature you standin' outside your little hutch, holdin' a carrot cake waitin' for hubby to come home.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Oh, please don't make fun of me, Mr, Valiant.  You don't know how hard it is being a woman looking the way I do.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, well, you don't know how hard it is bein' a man looking at a woman looking the way you do.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: I'm not bad, I'm just drawn that way.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I'm not complainin'.  But give me credit.  I'm the guy who took the pictures of you and Acme playin' pattycake, remember?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: So altruistic.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: It's the truth.  Why won't you believe it?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Cause I don't take Acme Dumb Pills.  I don't know what you're up to, lady, but I'm gonna nail you for the Acme murder.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: If I'm as bad as you think, what's stopping me from just killing you right now?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You shot Roger.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: That's not Roger.  It's one of Doom's men.  He killed R.K. Maroon.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Lady, I guess I had you pegged wrong.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Don't worry, you're not the first.  We better get out of here.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: It was Doom who killed Acme, you know?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: I didn't know who I could trust.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: We're even.  By the way, I did find your husband.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: He's right here in the...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: How did you get onto Doom?

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Marvin told me.  Doom was after his land.  Ne was afraid.  That's why he brought me his will.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: So where is it?

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: When I opened up the blue envelope, all that was inside was a blank piece of paper.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: A joker to the end.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Looks like our goose is cooked, our hash is slung, our fait is accompli...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Lemme guess where you got that from. Tell me somethin', what'd you ever see in that guy anyway?

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: He made me laugh.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Hold on a second.

turns.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
turns.text: Eddie, come on.

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: Tell me you didn't do a snoop job for a Toon named Roger the Rabbit.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: That's what you woke me up for?

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Just haven't been this close to Toontown for awhile.

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: They say the rabbit got the safe idea from a cartoon he was makin' the other day.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What a gasser.

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: Wait here...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Where'd this gargoyle come from anyway?

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: No one knows.  He bought the election a few years back.  He's been rulin' Toontown ever since.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What's with the dip?

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: That's how he gets rid of the troublemakers.  It's a combination of acetone, turpentine and paint remover. He calls it the...  Final Solution.

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Doom.

turns.speaker: LT. SANTINO
turns.text: Jesus Christ... <u>that</u> was the Judge?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Valiant, did you see the rabbit?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: He was blowin' his lines, all right. So what?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: So what?  He's already put me three weeks behind on the shooting schedule!

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: How much do you know about show business, Valiant?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Only there's no business like it, no business I know.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Yeah, and there's no business as expensive.  I'm twenty-five grand over budget on the latest Bunnysitter cartoon and it's all because that rabbit can't keep his mind on his work. And you know why?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: One too many safes dropped on his head?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Nah, that goes with the territory. He's a stunt bunny.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Here's the problem...  "Seen cooing over calamari with notsonew Sugar Daddy was Jessica Rabbit... wife of Maroon star, Roger".  His wife's a tramp, but he thinks she's Betty Crocker.  The doubt's eatin' him up.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: So what do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Get me a couple juicy pictures. Somethin' I can wise the rabbit up with.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I don't work in Toontown.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: You don't have to.  The rabbit's wife sings at an underground Toon revue joint called The Ink & Paint Club.  You can catch her in action there.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: The job's gonna cost you a hundred bucks.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: A hundred bucks?  That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: So's the job.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: I got him on loan from Disney.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Aren't you the lucky one...

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: When will I hear from you?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: As soon as is humanly possible.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Well, you better start thinkin' about drinkin' it black.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Frankly, I'm shocked.  Marvin Acme's been my friend and neighbor for thirty years.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Son-of-a-bitch...  Mr. Maroon, I think I'll be goin' now, so about the rest of my fee...

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Sure, Valiant, sure...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Hi, Mr. Maroon.  Remember me?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Valiant?  What're you doin' here?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I Just thought I'd drop by and show you a photograph.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: I've already seen your photographs.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, but I enlarged this one.  Thought you might be interested.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Maroon?  Whaddaya want?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Have you got the will?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Maybe.  Why?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Meet me at my studio at nine o'clock. If you've got the will maybe we can stop this thing.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Stop what?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: Valiant!  You surprised me.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: That was the idea.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You're not too good at this, are you, R.K.?

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: No... I'm not.  I'm a cartoon maker, not a murderer.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Well, everybody needs a hobby.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: No, you gotta understand, Valiant, I had nothin' to do with Acme gettin' killed.  I just wanted to sell my studio.  But they wouldn't buy my property unless Acme would sell his. And he wouldn't.  So I was gonna blackmail Acme with pictures of him and the rabbit's wife.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: You got the will in there, don't ya?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: You tricked me, damn you!

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Take it easy.

turns.speaker: MAROON
turns.text: There's no time to take it easy!  You don't realize the diabolical mind we're dealing with!

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Pattycake!  Pattycake!

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Baker's man... but no use ruinin' a good pair of shoes over it.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: My advice?  Hop on over to Reno, get yourself a quickie divorce.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Divorce?  Never!

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Aah!

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Aah!

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What the hell are you doin'?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: I needed a place to hide.  I'm in trouble, Eddie.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: So I hear.  Even talkin' to you could get me a rap for aiding and abetting.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Don't worry, Eddie, no one knows I'm here.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Oh, yeah?  Then how'd you find my house?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Well, I asked the newsboy on the corner.  He didn't know.  Then I asked a janitor, the fireman and finally the green grocer down the way.  He was very helpful.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: In other words, the whole goddamn world knows you're here!  Out!  Get out!

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Look, pal, if you're still here when I finish this drink, I'm callin' the police.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Don't do that!  I'm innocent I tell ya. The police'll just dip me.  They were waitin' for me when I got home last night.  I ran.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: If you're so innocent, why'd you run?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Gee, Eddie, I'm a rabbit.  We always run.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Eddie Valiant... you're under arrest! Just kidding...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You idiot.  I lost the key for those cuffs.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Hey!  What do you think you're doin'?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Sorry, Eddie, I forgot you're not a Toon.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Don't ever forget that.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Does this help?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, that's better.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You mean to tell me you coulda taken your hand outta that cuff at any time?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Well, no, not <u>any</u> time.  Only when it was funny.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Are you always this funny, or only on days when you're wanted for murder?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: My philosophy is if you don't have a sense of humor, you're better off dead.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah... well you just might get your wish.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah.  I think Maroon plays the part of the sound mind, your wife the sound body.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: I resent that innuendo!  My wife is completely innocent.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Your wife may be a lot of things, pal, but innocent isn't one of them.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: The habeus corpus is thickening.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah.  Except they screwed up.  I don't think they got the will.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Well, Acme had the will in his pocket that night at the club.  It was gone in the morning when the cops found the body.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Well, Mr. Smarty-Pants Detective, your logic is specious.  What prevented Mr. Acme from putting the will back in the safe before they killed him?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Because he's not forty feet tall.  The safe was up on the ceiling, remember?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Hey, don't I get an encore?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Why, you crazy Toon... I've been out there riskin' my neck for you.   I come back here and you're singin' and dancin'.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: But that's my calling, my purpose, my raison d'etre.  Toons are supposed to make people laugh... and believe me, those people needed a laugh.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: And when they're done laughin' , they're gonna call the cops.  That guy Angelo would rat on you for a nickel!

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Angelo?  He's a pal, a chum...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: An arsonist and a kidnapper.  He just got outta prison.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Well... I still don't think he'd turn me in.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Just because you got 'em to laugh?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: A laugh can be a powerful thing, Eddie. Sometimes it's the only weapon we have in life.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I think I prefer the Smith and Wesson variety.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: I've met some cynical and miserable humans in my time.  But you, Edward Valiant, are positively funereal!

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Well, right now it's gonna be your funereal.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Hey, doesn't the rabbit even get a last request?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: A blindfold, cigarette, noseplugs? Just kidding.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I think you want a drink.  How about it, Judge?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Here you go, kid... say hi to Casper for me.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: But, Eddie, you know what happens when...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Drink it, jerk.  All of it.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Oh, Eddie, that was quick thinkin'. Nothin' like usin' the old noggin, the noodle, the grey matter...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: If I'm so smart, how come I'm runnin' from the law with a Toon?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Valiant and Valiant?  Who's the other Valiant?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: My brother.  Get inside.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: So what's our plan, our scenario, our modus operandi?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: We can't do anything till it's dark.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Say, who's this guy laughin'?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Me.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Gee, I didn't recognize you... I've never seen you laugh before.  That your brother makin' the rabbit ears?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What is this, Twenty Questions?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You damn Toon!  No wonder they picked you for the patsy.  Always gotta play the fool.  You make me sick!

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Gee, you shamuses are a tough audience, but what happened to you that was so dark, lurid, embittering?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: You wanna know?  Well, since you're so goddamn curious, I'll tell ya.  One of you Toons killed my brother.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: A Toon?  Noooo.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, a Toon.  It was the guy who killed Bambi's mother.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Him?  Oh, he was vile, heinous, despicable... a smear on the drafting board.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah, everybody thought so.  But me and Teddy got a kick out of Toons.  All Toons.  We couldn't see the bad in 'em. And when this guy was accused of knockin' over the First National Bank of Toontown, we took his case.  But when we looked into it, we found out he did do it after all.  We went to his house to take him in.  But he was wise. He got the drop on us... literally.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Safe?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Piano.  Guy got away, disappeared into Toontown.  Nobody ever saw him again.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: I'll get it.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Get away from there.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Wrong number?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: No, it's not.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Gee, Eddie, you're not gonna go, are ya?  Maroon'll be layin' for ya at nine o'clock.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: That's why I'll be there at 8:45.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: I tell you what, maybe I better come with you.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: You know, Eddie, I'm not as much of a chump, and a patsy, a yokel as you think.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: How much is a shave and a haircut, Roger?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Two bits.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I rest my case.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: If I don't make it back here by ten...

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: ... I'd head for Cucamonga.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: What the hell are you doin' in there?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: I followed you to the Maroon Studios. When I heard those shots, I thought I'd help you and investigate the inside of this trunk.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Real good, Rog... but maybe you better let me take over.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Not before I satisfy my sense of moral outrage.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: That's not blood.  That's ink.  That goof Acme squirted me with some the other day.  Why it's comin' 'through now, I don't know.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: That's because it's Disappearing-Reappearing Ink.  Shows up three days later.  Gives you enough time to get away from the victim so he doesn't punch you in the nose.  Great gag.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Say Roger, remember that love letter you wrote your wife at the Ink & Paint Club?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: I think you oughta read it to her.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Keep reading...

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: Hey, it's the will.  I, Marvin Acme, of sound mind and body, hoo-hoo-hoo-hoo, do hereby bequeath in perpetuity the property known as Toontown to those loveable characters...

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: No, kid, you're a real hero.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: I guess I am at that.  Cigar?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: By the way, Roger, you were right about your wife.  She's a good lady.  I'm glad you got her back.

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: And I'm glad you got your sense of humor back.  Think you'll keep it?

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Only time will tell.

turns.speaker: VALIANT
turns.text: Pretty good cigar.  Where'd you get it?

turns.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
turns.text: From this box here...

turns.speaker: ABRAHAM
turns.text: Boo! Ah, ha ha. Ooh. Boo! Ha ha ha.

turns.speaker: SAMPSON
turns.text: I will bite my thumb at them; which is a disgrace to them, if they bear it.

turns.speaker: ABRAHAM
turns.text: Do you bite your thumb at us, sir?

turns.speaker: SAMPSON
turns.text: I do bite my thumb, sir!

turns.speaker: ABRAHAM
turns.text: Do you bite your thumb at us? Sir.

turns.speaker: SAMPSON
turns.text: [Aside to GREGORY] Is the law on our side, if I say ay?

turns.speaker: ABRAHAM
turns.text: Quarrel sir! no, sir.

turns.speaker: SAMPSON
turns.text: If you do, sir, I am for you.  I serve as good a man as you.

turns.speaker: ABRAHAM
turns.text: No better?

turns.speaker: SAMPSON
turns.text: Uh? Uh?

turns.speaker: BALTHASAR
turns.text: If she is well then nothing can be ill. Her body rests in Capel's monument, and her immortal part with the angel's lives. I saw her laid low. Pardon me for bringing these ill news.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Then I defy you, stars! JULIET! JULIET! I will hence tonight.

turns.speaker: BALTHASAR
turns.text: Have patience!

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Leave Me!

turns.speaker: BALTHASAR
turns.text: Your looks are pale and wild and do import some misadventure.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Tush, thou art deceived. Hast thou no letters to me from the priest? [Balthsasr shakes his head no.] No matter. Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee tonight. I will hence tonight.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Live and be prosperous; and farewell good fellow.

turns.speaker: BALTHASAR
turns.text: Then I'll leave thee.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Tempt not a desperate man!

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Romeo! Romeo!

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: Romeo! humours! madman! passion! lover! I conjure thee by Rosaline's bright eyes, By her high forehead and her scarlet lip, By her fine foot, straight leg and quivering thigh! O, Romeo that she were An open ass, and thou a poperin pear! Romeo, good night: I'll to my truckle-bed; This field-bed is too cold for me to sleep.

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: Where the devil should this Romeo be? Came he not home to-night?

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Not to his father's; I spoke with his man.

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: Why that pale hard-hearted wench, that Rosaline. Torments him so, that he will sure run mad.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Tybalt, the kinsman of old Capulet, Hath sent a letter to his father's house.

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: A challenge, on my life.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Romeo will answer it?

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: Any man that can write may answer a letter.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Nay, he will answer the letter's master, how he dares, being dared.

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: But alas poor Romeo! he is already dead; stabbed with a white wench's black eye; shot through the ear with a love-song; the very pin of his heart cleft with the blind bow-boy's butt-shaft: and is he a man to encounter Tybalt?

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Why, what is Tybalt?

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: More than prince of cats. He is the courageous captain of compliments. He fights as you sing prick- song, keeps time, distance, and proportion; he rests his minim rest, one, two, and the third in your bosom: the very butcher of a silk button, a duellist, a duellist; a gentleman of the very first house, of the first and second cause: the immortal passado! punto reverso! the hai!

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: Keep away the cats! Thou art like one of these fellows that, when he enters the confines of a tavern claps me his sword upon the table and says, "God send me no need of thee." and by the operation of the second cup draws him on the drawer, when indeed there is no need.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Am I like Such a fellow?

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: Thou art as hot a Jack in thy mood as any in Verona.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: By my head here come the Capulets.

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: By my heel, I care not.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Either withdraw unto some private place, or reason coldly of your grievences, or else depart. Here all eyes gaze on us.

turns.speaker: MERCUTIO
turns.text: Men's eyes were made to look, and let them gaze. I will not budge for no man's pleasure, I.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Why then, O brawling love, O loving hate, O anything of nothing first create. heavy lightness. Serious vanity. Misshapen chaos of well seeming forms.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Good-morrow, cousin.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Is the day so young?

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: But new struck cuz.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Ay me! Sad hours seem long. Was that my father that went hence so fast?

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: It was. What sadness lengthens Romeo's hours?

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Not having that, which, having, makes them short.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: In love?

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Out--

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Of love?

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Out of her favour, where I am in love.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Alas, that love, so gentle in his view, Should be so tyrannous and rough in proof!

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Alas, that love, whose view is muffled still, Should, without eyes, see pathways to his will! Where shall we dine? O me! What fray was here? Yet tell me not, for I have heard it all. Here's much to do with hate, but more with love. Why, then, O brawling love! O loving hate! O any thing, of nothing first create! O heavy lightness! Serious vanity! Misshapen chaos of well-seeming forms! Feather of lead-- [Benvolio Snickers] Dost thou not laugh?

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: No, cuz, I rather weep.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Good heart, at what?

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: At thy good heart's oppression.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Farewell, my cuz.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Soft! I will go along; An if you leave me so, you do me wrong.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Tell me in sadness, who is that you love.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: In sadness, cousin, I do love a woman.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: I aim'd so near, when I supposed you loved.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: A right good marks-man! And she's fair I love.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: A right fair mark, fair cuz, is soonest hit.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Well, in that hit you miss: she'll not be hit With Cupid's arrow; Nor bide the encounter of assailing eyes, Nor open her lap to saint-seducing gold:

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Then she hath sworn that she will still live chaste?

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: She hath, and in that sparing makes huge waste.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Be ruled by me, forget to think of her.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Teach me how I should forget to think.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: By giving liberty unto thine eyes; Examine other beauties. Why, Romeo, art thou mad?

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Not mad, but bound more than a mad-man is; Shut up in prison, kept without my food, Whipp'd and tormented. Good day, good fellow.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Every man betake him to his legs.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: But 'tis no wit to go.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: This wind, you talk of, blows us from ourselves; Supper is done, and we shall come too late.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: I fear, too early: for my mind misgives Some consequence yet hanging in the stars Shall bitterly begin his fearful date With this night's revels and expire the term Of a despised life closed within my breast By some vile forfeit of untimely death. But He, that hath the steerage of my course, Direct my sail! On, lusty gentlemen.

turns.speaker: ROMEO
turns.text: Forbear this outrage, good Mercutio.

turns.speaker: BENVOLIO
turns.text: Art thou hurt?
